text:
"Three Men and a Baby" is a 1987 American comedy movie directed by Leonard Nimoy and starring Tom Selleck, Steve Guttenberg, and Ted Danson. It is about the adventures of three bachelors as they try to help raise a baby girl from one of the bachelors. The script was based on the 1985 French movie "Three Men and a Cradle".
The movie was the biggest American box office hit of that year, and made $167 million in the United States and Canada and $240 million worldwide.
